initiatives.\xa0Will also play a key role in annual budget development and periodic review', 'Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, or at least four years of demonstrated functional expertise in financial and data analysis', 'Serve as a business partner and have direct exposure to executive leadership, directors, divisional vice presidents, and senior managementPerform analysis ['Major CPG Tech company is looking for a UX Research Assistant. This is a great long-term freelance opportunity for a chance to build your resume with a big industry name!Must have qualitative research focused on more psychology questions experience to apply.The UX Research Assistant Responsibilities:- conduct smaller interviews with users for specific features on product- determine what method needs to be deployed based on ticket assigned such as interview questions, etc.- work on UX research lifecycle including study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting, communicating results to stakeholders- Partner with the product, design and marketing teams to scope out projects and coordinate testing needs- Continuously evaluate research management tools and processes to ensure they are efficient, high quality, and scalableThe UX Research Assistant Requirements:- 2+ years experience as UX Researcher, not UX Design- portfolio showing past work deliverables, and the ability to extract actionable insights from qualitative and quantitative data.- Strong understanding of UX Research best practices- Proficient in JIRA, Confluence, UserTesting.com, and Qualtrics- Thrive in startup environmentsTo be considered, send resumes and portfolios today!']

['Management of CRO’s to track the progress and completion of work orders', 'BA, BS, (Research Assistant) or MS (Research Associate) in a field related to neuroscience or biology with experience in basic biology, cell biology, biochemistry and/or pharmacology or a closely related discipline', 'Self-motivation and strong organizational skills required', 'Experience with various in vitro and in vivo technologies', '1-5 years’ laboratory experience using cell biological and biochemical technologies in a laboratory setting', 'Join EnClear in creating novel, first-in-class therapeutic devices for neurodegenerative and other diseases. This position is within R&D reporting to the Head of Biology. The primary responsibility of the newly created position is to assist in the development of the proprietary EnClear system for (1) targeting and destroying toxic and inflammatory proteins found in CSF and (2) a novel delivery system. ['', 'To Apply:', 'Ability to contribute to grant applications.', 'The Lieber Institute for Brain Development was conceived from the realization that a new approach is needed to fully exploit the unprecedented scientific opportunities to accomplish the critical goal of helping affected individuals and their families. The Lieber Institute aims to transform the research landscape in two ways: by providing new tools for scientific discovery and by developing new collaborative approaches to achieve our ambitious mission.', 'Experiences:', 'Contributes to publications.', '\ufeffEEOC Statement:', 'To Apply: Interested applicants should submit a cover letter and resume with the subject line “Staff Scientist I – Sequencing Core”.', 'The mission of the Lieber Institute for Brain Development is to translate the understanding of basic genetic and molecular mechanisms of schizophrenia and related developmental brain disorders into clinical advances that change the lives of affected individuals. We are an independent 501(c)(3) medical research institute located in the Bioscience Park on the campus of the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine and Hospital. ', 'Education: Master’s degree or higher in computer science, computational biology, biomedical engineering, or a related field. ', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0All other physical demands in a standard laboratory environment.', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Reaching and grasping to manipulate objects with fingers;', 'The Sequencing Core Group at the Lieber Institute for Brain Development (LIBD) is recruiting a Staff Scientist I in Computer Sciense/Bioinformatics/Data Science/Computational Biology preferably with previous experience working in human genetics and genomics in postmortem, animal, and cellular data. This position primarily involves processing and integrating large-scale genomics datasets into ongoing institute-wide projects.', 'The successful applicant will use these data to create databases and tools to benefit Lieber Institute researchers. The scientist will be committed to a common mission, a team effort, and collaborations across academia and industry.', 'Familiarity with literature searching for precedent.', 'Job Summary:', 'Proficiency in Linux, and at least one low-level language (e.g. C++, Java, etc)', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Remaining in a seated or standing position for extended periods of time;', 'Works collaboratively with Institute scientists as a resource provider and internal consultant.', 'Excellent problem-solving skills', 'Works both collaboratively and independently in executing research studies.', '** If accommodations are needed due to pregnancy or a disability, please contact jobs@libd.org\xa0\xa0', 'Physical Requirements:', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Communication skills using the spoken and written word; ', 'Manages and mentors people with guidance.', 'Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:', 'Establishes timelines and milestones for projects and meets them.', 'Ability to communicate experiment results to lab and institute-wide.', 'A little about us:', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Mobility, including the ability to maneuver around a laboratory setting including the ability to move materials weighing up to 25 pounds;', '-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication;', 'Minimum 5 + years of related experience, and a combination of the following attributes:', 'Focus is working on Lieber Institute projects under the direction of an Investigator or Research Scientist.Works collaboratively with Institute scientists as a resource provider and internal consultant.Designs, executes and troubleshoots experiments\\analyses independently or with minimal guidance.Manages and mentors people with guidance.Establishes timelines and milestones for projects and meets them.Contributes to publications.Ability to contribute to grant applications.Works both collaboratively and independently in executing research studies.Familiarity with literature searching for precedent.Ability to communicate experiment results to lab and institute-wide.', '\ufeffEEOC Statement: At the Lieber Institute, we are committed to a work environment of mutual respect where employment decisions are based on merit. As an equal opportunity employer, the Lieber Institute does not discriminate in employment opportunities on the basis of race, color, religion, color, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy,\xa0marital status, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability (physical or mental),\xa0genetic information, military service, or other non-merit based factors protected by state or federal law or local ordinance, with regard to any position or employment for which the applicant or employee is qualified.\xa0', 'Minimum 5 + years of related experience, and a combination of the following attributes:Proficiency in Linux, and at least one low-level language (e.g. C++, Java, etc)Proficiency in database managementExcellent problem-solving skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills', 'The Lieber Institute offers a generous benefits package which includes paid holidays, sick, personal and vacation time off.\xa0', 'Focus is working on Lieber Institute projects under the direction of an Investigator or Research Scientist.', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills', 'Minimum Qualifications (Mandatory):', 'To Apply: ', 'Proficiency in database management', 'Designs, executes and troubleshoots experiments\\analyses independently or with minimal guidance.']

job_title: Data Scientist, Health Economics & Real-World Evidence, Evidence for Access, USMA (POSITION IS BASED IN SSF, MAY CONSIDER REMOTE)
job_text: ['', ' The Data Scientist of Technical Institute (TI) is a member of the US Medical Affairs Evidence for Access (E4A) Medical Unit. He/she assists senior TI team members to design and execute retrospective observational research using in-house real-world data (RWD). ', ' Strong attention-to-detail ', 'I act on behalf of the whole company, not just my team.', 'Experience In Publication In Peer-reviewed Journal Is Preferred', 'Job Facts', 'SCHEDULE', ' Design, develop, test, implement, validate, document, and maintain effective and efficient SAS or R programs for conducting, analyzing and reporting observational database studies. ', 'I put the patient first, always.', 'I build our reputation.', ' Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Advanced statistics and health economics concepts are a plus. ', ' Experience in observational research study analysis. Working knowledge of relevant national healthcare systems, specifically with large observational and insurance claims databases, experienced with diagnostic, procedure, and pharmaceutical coding systems ', ' Strong oral and writing communication skills to summarize and explain the findings to audiences who may not have technical background. ', 'I am accountable.', 'Digitization, Data And Insights COMPANY/DIVISION', 'Programming Experience In R Is a Plus', 'I act with urgency.', ' For candidate with a master’s degree, a minimal of two years of prior work experience in academic/research institute, consulting, managed care, government, and/or pharmaceutical industry. ', 'JOB FUNCTION', ' Master’s Degree (health policy and management, economics, epidemiology, public policy, or health services research); Doctoral Degree in above or other related disciplines is preferred. ', 'I follow the science.', ' Support senior TI members to design and execute retrospective observational studies for Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) and Health Policy and System Research (HPSR) using in-house RWD ', 'Requirements', 'I have a growth mindset.', 'Operating Principles ', ' Contribute to program library and web-based tool development and maintenance. ', 'I build a culture of trust.', 'The Position', ' With guidance from senior TI members, analyze secondary data, including insurance claims, electronic medical record, patient survey, and disease registry. ', 'Who We Are', 'JOB TYPE', ' Participate in all required Genentech and E4A training and development programs. Comply with all internal policies and external regulations. ', ' Provide quality check of TI peer’s programs. ', ' Support the development of research protocol and statistical analysis plan. Recommend and implement appropriate analytical methodology (e.g., propensity score matching, regression analysis…;etc) for RWD studies. ', ' SAS Base, SAS/STAT, SAS/GRAPH, SQL and macro programming experience ', 'I am obsessed with meeting customer needs.', 'I radically simplify and prioritize for impact.', ' Demonstrated ability to learn and embrace new technologies, applications and solutions ', ' Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, team-based environment ', 'I am inclusive.', 'Key Responsibilities Include']

job_title: Data Engineer- No third parties plz
job_text: ['', 'Strong communication skills with consumers at various levels. ', '• Use critical thinking to identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets to solve problems, and develop recommendations based on findings', 'Location: DALLAS, TX', 'Experienced Analyst / Engineer with data centric experience. ', 'Duration: 12 Months', 'TeradataOracleSQL serverExperience with AWS SageMaker', 'SQL server', 'Duration:', 'Experience with AWS SageMaker', 'Location:', '• Ability to see big picture from various details and articulate the key differentiators to decision makers', 'Required Skills:', 'Unix Shell Scripts', 'At least 10 years of experience in data warehouse architecture, data modeling, ETL Mapping, data flows, data analysis using NoSQL conceptsDemonstrated delivery of results on past projects leveraging various analytics, data integration and management technologies involving both operational and analytical applicationsStrong communication skills with consumers at various levels. Able to present complex and technical information clearly in ‘business language.’Ability to gather data from various systems using database languages and/or programming languages (such as but not limited to)SQL & NoSQLPythonJavaAb InitioUnix Shell Scripts', 'The Engineer will also be responsible for collaborating across business and technology teams to understand the various data domains to support our strategic initiatives. Strategic analysis may include the measurement of baseline or quantitative value on impact; economic and environment landscape that impact our business and industry; or helping uncover dependencies on cross functional areas and data availability.', 'Ab Initio', 'Java', '• Understanding or exposure to modern data management concepts or approaches that enable enterprises adopt digital technologies, such as Events & Rules based solutions, stream analytics, etc.', '#CJ –28982', 'Data Engineer', 'The Data Innovation Team rapidly builds and tests new, cutting-edge data architectures to enable Data Science and Innovation initiatives across the enterprise. ', 'This includes working with the Data Science and Innovation Teams to better understand their data requirements, identifying the right sources for the data, and then rapidly providing the data that will power both the Data Science models and Innovation initiatives.', 'SQL & NoSQL', '• Through collaboration with team members, develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality', '\xa0', 'Job Description:', 'Ability to gather data from various systems using database languages and/or programming languages (such as but not limited to)', 'Demonstrated delivery of results on past projects leveraging various analytics, data integration and management technologies involving both operational and analytical applications', 'Python', 'Must have experience asking effective questions, probing for important details and translating into actionable recommendations. ', 'The Engineer must have a deep understanding of Data Management software and tools in both operational and analytical solutions, the architecture needed to support these solutions, as well as experience in Data Management consulting methods and tools.', 'Teradata', 'Oracle', 'Demonstrated expertise in working with several databases (such as but not limited to):', 'Specifically, the Team is responsible for developing and delivering a Data Innovation Environment that will provision data in new and innovative ways. ', 'The Engineer should possess curiosity, willing to learn emerging technology-based solutions, and passion for ‘all things data’', 'The Engineer will have a primary responsibility to support the prototype activities around data innovation. ', 'At least 10 years of experience in data warehouse architecture, data modeling, ETL Mapping, data flows, data analysis using NoSQL concepts', 'The Data Innovation Team rapidly builds and tests new, cutting-edge data architectures to enable Data Science and Innovation initiatives across the enterprise. Specifically, the Team is responsible for developing and delivering a Data Innovation Environment that will provision data in new and innovative ways. This includes working with the Data Science and Innovation Teams to better understand their data requirements, identifying the right sources for the data, and then rapidly providing the data that will power both the Data Science models and Innovation initiatives.Experienced Analyst / Engineer with data centric experience. Must have experience asking effective questions, probing for important details and translating into actionable recommendations. The Engineer must have a deep understanding of Data Management software and tools in both operational and analytical solutions, the architecture needed to support these solutions, as well as experience in Data Management consulting methods and tools.The Engineer will have a primary responsibility to support the prototype activities around data innovation. The Engineer will also be responsible for collaborating across business and technology teams to understand the various data domains to support our strategic initiatives. Strategic analysis may include the measurement of baseline or quantitative value on impact; economic and environment landscape that impact our business and industry; or helping uncover dependencies on cross functional areas and data availability.The Engineer should possess curiosity, willing to learn emerging technology-based solutions, and passion for ‘all things data’', 'Able to present complex and technical information clearly in ‘business language.’']

['', 'Present scientific findings to the A-Alpha Bio team and to external partners', 'Mentor, train, and manage junior members of the R&D and Production Teams', 'Experience with protein engineering, antibody engineering, and drug discovery', 'Qualifications', 'Responsibilities', 'Synthetic biology experience and strong molecular biology skills', 'Experience with DNA encoded libraries (yeast display, phage display, yeast-two-hybrid)Experience with protein engineering, antibody engineering, and drug discoveryTechnical proficiency with at least 1 macromolecular modeling suite, preferably RosettaFamiliarity with next-generation sequencing platforms, including sample preparation and analysis for Illumina and Oxford NanoporeStrong statistics and data science skills in Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy)', 'Technical proficiency with at least 1 macromolecular modeling suite, preferably Rosetta', 'We offer competitive compensation including a pay package, benefits, and significant equity in a fast-growing start-up. Job title will be set based on experience and track record, so we encourage applicants with a wide range of backgrounds to apply.', 'Strong written and oral communication skills', 'A-Alpha Bio is a seed-stage drug discovery company located in Seattle, WA that partners with pharmaceutical companies to discover, optimize, and characterize high-impact therapeutics.', 'We are seeking a skilled Scientist to join our R&D team. The Scientist will work in a small team setting to execute, optimize, and expand our AlphaSeq platform for drug discovery and optimization. From a technical perspective, the role will largely involve designing and constructing plasmids and engineered yeast strains, performing and optimizing yeast assays, and carrying out next-generation sequencing workflows and data analysis. The Scientist will also be responsible for designing, managing, and executing complex internal and external projects and communicating work plans in presentations and written reports. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment.', 'Lead, manage and execute R&D projects for external partners, collaborators, and funding agenciesDesign, manage, and execute internal R&D programs to expand and optimize AlphaSeq for drug discovery applicationsLead and participate in technical and strategy meetings and assist in decision making with recommendations based on data gathered internally and from the literatureTransfer developed and optimized processes to the Production Team; write and revise process documentation and assist with protocol transferPresent scientific findings to the A-Alpha Bio team and to external partnersMentor, train, and manage junior members of the R&D and Production TeamsAuthor detailed, accurate, and accessible documentation of experiments and dataStay current with scientific literature and present to the team on relevant topics', 'Transfer developed and optimized processes to the Production Team; write and revise process documentation and assist with protocol transfer', 'Stay current with scientific literature and present to the team on relevant topics', '\xa0Preferred', 'A-Alpha Bio’s Mission', 'Data-driven drug development enabled by synthetic biology and next generation sequencing', 'A-Alpha Bio Summary', 'Author detailed, accurate, and accessible documentation of experiments and data', 'Impressive technical track record at top-tier academic institutions or companies', 'Role Description', 'Lead and participate in technical and strategy meetings and assist in decision making with recommendations based on data gathered internally and from the literature', 'Design, manage, and execute internal R&D programs to expand and optimize AlphaSeq for drug discovery applications', 'A-Alpha Bio is located in Seattle at Fluke Hall, a startup incubator operated by the University of Washington. While the startup lifestyle occasionally requires grueling hours, we strongly value the need for a work-life balance and time out of the lab/office. We are fortunate to be situated in a region that is renowned for its premier outdoor activities, including hiking, biking, climbing, skiing, kayaking, and sailing.', 'Experience with DNA encoded libraries (yeast display, phage display, yeast-two-hybrid)', 'Familiarity with next-generation sequencing platforms, including sample preparation and analysis for Illumina and Oxford Nanopore', 'About A-Alpha Bio', 'Ph.D. in Life/Chemical/Physical/Engineering Sciences', 'Lead, manage and execute R&D projects for external partners, collaborators, and funding agencies', 'Ability to take initiative, multi-task, prioritize, adapt rapidly to changes, and work collaboratively as part of a team with diverse experiences and skill levels', 'Self-motivation, intellectually curiosity, and excitement to carry out interdisciplinary research involving complex experimental and bioinformatics pipelines', 'Strong statistics and data science skills in Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy)', 'Required', 'A-Alpha Bio is a seed-stage biotech startup commercializing cutting edge synthetic biology tools enabled by next generation sequencing for improved drug discovery and development. We spun out of the University of Washington’s Institute for Protein Design and Center for Synthetic Biology in 2018 after patenting and publishing our AlphaSeq platform for high-throughput protein interaction characterization. Since closing our seed financing in September 2019, we have focused on partnering with pharmaceutical companies to discover and optimize drugs for therapeutic areas ranging from infectious disease to cancer. We have been growing rapidly and new members of the team should expect a fast-paced and highly dynamic work environment. We are building a diverse, meritocratic, and supportive team that values hard work, creativity, transparency, individual and team growth, flexibility, and kindness.', 'Ph.D. in Life/Chemical/Physical/Engineering SciencesImpressive technical track record at top-tier academic institutions or companiesSynthetic biology experience and strong molecular biology skillsSelf-motivation, intellectually curiosity, and excitement to carry out interdisciplinary research involving complex experimental and bioinformatics pipelinesAbility to take initiative, multi-task, prioritize, adapt rapidly to changes, and work collaboratively as part of a team with diverse experiences and skill levelsStrong written and oral communication skills']

job_title: Interim Senior Research Scientist, Health Care Delivery, Disease Modeling
job_text: ['', ' Inspire people to take action to change the world. ', " Gather, analyze, and model data from health systems in LMIC's. Identify features, structures, and relationships in these data Build projects that are well aligned within a strategy that supports high-level deliverables Work closely with external collaborators to acquire data, develop impactful research directions, and adjust models. Model the efficiency and effectiveness of primary health care delivery and other health interventions Review scientific and grey literature on the delivery of primary healthcare and other health interventions to inform on problems, identify new analyses to perform, and to set the context for current research Support polio eradication efforts Write summaries of results to be used in policy recommendations, white papers, and scientific publications Write research articles and conference presentations communicating projects and results to the scientific community Present work to research and policy audiences. ", 'All Applicants And Employees Who Are Drawn To Serve The Mission Of The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Will Enjoy Equality Of Opportunity And Fair Treatment Without Regard To', ' Gender Identity', 'Present work to research and policy audiences.', 'We Have Four Missions To', 'Core Responsibilities', ' Race Color Age Religion Pregnancy Sex Sexual Orientation Disability Gender Identity Gender Expression National Origin Genetic Information Veteran Status Marital Status Prior Protected ActivityPosted Yesterday Full time B015213We Have Four Missions ToGuided by the belief that all lives have equal value, the Bill and Melinda Gates foundation pride ourselves in being ‘impatient optimists’ whose purpose is to work to reduce inequity. Our vision is to ensure a world where every person has the opportunity to live a healthy, productive life.  Ensure more children and young people survive and thrive;   Empower the poorest, especially women and girls, to transform their lives;   Combat infectious diseases that particularly affect the poorest; and   Inspire people to take action to change the world.  Key to enabling these missions is our commitment to science and innovation, collaboration and partnership, measurement and rigor, as well as optimism and risk taking. Based in Seattle, the foundation has a worldwide staff of 1,500 people and is led by CEO Mark Suzman and co-chair William H. Gates Sr., under the direction of Bill and Melinda Gates and Warren Buffett. We have offices in the United States, Europe, India, China and Africa.', ' Age', ' Veteran Status', 'Working knowledge of health system data sources such as health facility surveys, health management information systems, and electronic medical records.', ' Prior experience working within a health system in LMIC, and in particular on health system strengthening interventions. As an equal opportunity employer, Care.com recognizes the power of a diverse workforce and encourages applications from individuals with varied experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds.**____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Company Overview:Care.com, an IAC (NASDAQ: IAC) company, was founded in 2006 on the understanding that quality family care is both a fundamental human need and a key driver of economic growth and empowerment. When children receive quality care in their critical formative years, they are on a path to achievement and success. Women disproportionately shoulder caregiving responsibilities, but when they have supports in place that enable them to work, our economy grows. When seniors receive quality care in their homes, healthcare costs decline with fewer hospital stays. When we have a strong caregiving workforce, all these things are possible.', 'full-time contract']

Only applications submitted directly via this link will be considered: http://bit.ly/LGIMA-DATA-ENGINEER-APPLICATION', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Open source data lineage and metadata discovery tools like Marquez and Amundsen.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0AWS IAM: 4+ years.', 'This role will be responsible for re-engineering and modernization of data stores and data pipelines already in place as well as the implementation of net new solutions targeting customer focused value and drive the next generation of products and services. It will involve the build out of both strategic distributed systems as a greenfield development and the improvement and migration of legacy systems.', 'The candidate must be an excellent verbal and written communicator who is able to build strong relationships and act with a fiduciary-like approach working for product teams and business stakeholders, ultimately ensuring that the data product meets their requirements and expectations.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 JSON File Format']

job_title: Senior Survey Researcher, Public Policy Evaluation
job_text: ['', 'Training in survey methodology and social science research (e.g., survey design, psychometrics, cognitive interviews, administering surveys, data cleaning and management, topline reporting, significance testing, multivariate regressions).', 'Qualifications:', 'At Fors Marsh Group (FMG), we combine the power of science and strategy to improve people’s lives. Each day, we work with institutions and organizations that seek to disrupt markets, understand or influence behavior, drive action on a national or global scale, and create a positive impact on the world. FMG was created with the vision of becoming a refreshingly different type of research and consulting firm by solving challenges through solutions steeped in scientific theory, methodological rigor, and creativity. This vision has shaped core capabilities led by experts in their field, which include health communications, human capital management, digital marketing and design and data science.', 'FMG’s Public Policy Evaluation (PPE) practice is seeking an experienced, intelligent, and motivated Senior Survey Researcher to contribute to survey research projects and projects examining the implementation and impact of policies and programs. This individual will conduct survey research and guide research teams to understand client needs, design research and evaluation projects, collect and analyze data, summarize findings, and provide recommendations through reports, visualizations, and interactive data dashboards. Independence and comfort executing different steps of the survey research lifecycle – including instrument development, fielding, data collection, analysis, and reporting – is essential, as is the ability to collaborate across teams with FMG colleagues.', 'As a Certified B Corporation and Best Place to Work, FMG’s positive impact extends far beyond our client portfolio. FMG makes a difference in the community through pro bono service, difference in our ecosystem through environmentally conscious business practices and partnerships, and difference with our employees through a value driven workplace.', 'Consulting and executing best practices for a survey’s approach to quality control, administration, and data management', 'Contributing to a range of survey research projects across FMG’s PPE practice area for federal and private clients', 'Supporting the execution of survey research projects across all phases of project lifecycle.', 'Managing the successful execution of PPE projects, including scheduling, technical quality, financial performance, and client satisfaction.', 'A minimum of 4 years of post-graduate applied experience contributing to and leading survey projects, preferably for federal clients.', 'Thinking creatively to help clients answer the questions, “did this work”, “will this work”, and “how can it work better”. Contributing knowledge and expertise to the methods, theories, models, and processes involved in the collection, analysis, and evaluation of social programs.Supporting the execution of survey research projects across all phases of project lifecycle.Consulting with clients to identify research questions and the best survey and analysis methodology to assess themContributing to a range of survey research projects across FMG’s PPE practice area for federal and private clientsConsulting and executing best practices for a survey’s approach to quality control, administration, and data managementAnalyzing and interpreting results using descriptive and inferential quantitative analyses. Combining survey data with administrative data and paradata.Contributing to PPE’s business development activities, including identifying opportunities, writing proposal sections, and developing project budgets.Managing the successful execution of PPE projects, including scheduling, technical quality, financial performance, and client satisfaction.', 'Analyzing and interpreting results using descriptive and inferential quantitative analyses. Combining survey data with administrative data and paradata.', 'Applicants may be subject to a low-level government security investigation and must meet eligibility criteria for access to sensitive information.', 'Opportunities to conduct high quality research and influence decision making.', 'Consulting with clients to identify research questions and the best survey and analysis methodology to assess them', 'Demonstrated ability developing a variety of high-quality written and presentation work products and deliverables with minimal supervision.', 'Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain client relationships.', 'Graduate degree in social sciences, public polcy, or related field.', 'Willingness and ability to learn new research topic areas, methods, and analytic approaches.', 'Graduate degree in social sciences, public polcy, or related field.A minimum of 4 years of post-graduate applied experience contributing to and leading survey projects, preferably for federal clients.Demonstrated ability developing a variety of high-quality written and presentation work products and deliverables with minimal supervision.Proficient in at least one statistical analysis software package (STATA preferred, SPSS, or R) and proficient in Microsoft Office computer applications (Excel, Word, Power Point).Training in survey methodology and social science research (e.g., survey design, psychometrics, cognitive interviews, administering surveys, data cleaning and management, topline reporting, significance testing, multivariate regressions).Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain client relationships.Willingness and ability to learn new research topic areas, methods, and analytic approaches.Demonstration of strong verbal and written communications skills, including proposal writing.Applicants may be subject to a low-level government security investigation and must meet eligibility criteria for access to sensitive information.', 'A collaborative, small business environment where staff are self-motivated and enthusiastic about their field of study.', 'Responsibilities include:', 'A collaborative, small business environment where staff are self-motivated and enthusiastic about their field of study.Opportunities to conduct high quality research and influence decision making.Highly competitive benefit/compensation package.', 'Demonstration of strong verbal and written communications skills, including proposal writing.', 'Highly competitive benefit/compensation package.', 'We Offer:', 'Proficient in at least one statistical analysis software package (STATA preferred, SPSS, or R) and proficient in Microsoft Office computer applications (Excel, Word, Power Point).', 'Contributing to PPE’s business development activities, including identifying opportunities, writing proposal sections, and developing project budgets.', 'Thinking creatively to help clients answer the questions, “did this work”, “will this work”, and “how can it work better”. Contributing knowledge and expertise to the methods, theories, models, and processes involved in the collection, analysis, and evaluation of social programs.']

['', 'Design and manage data architecture standards, protocols, frameworks ensuring data security and compliance with the latest industry standards.', 'At least 2 years of hands-on experience in designing and building data pipelines, analytical data applications and BI Reporting.', 'Proficient in SQL and Tableau, familiar with at least one coding language in Python, R or Scala.', "Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field such as Mathematics and Statistics, preferably with focus on Data Analytics.At least 2 years of hands-on experience in designing and building data pipelines, analytical data applications and BI Reporting.Proficient in SQL and Tableau, familiar with at least one coding language in Python, R or Scala.Analytical thinker with ability to continually analyze existing data stack and share new data product recommendations to improve data consolidation, management, analysis and interpretation.Experience in using Cloud based managed services and Big Data Environments for data warehousing/analytics is a big plus - e.g. Amazon RedShift, Snowflake.Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.Create data tools and analytics for business team members that assist them in building and optimizing the product into an innovative industry leader.Experience with AWS in enterprise cloud environment and technically skilled in modern big data principles and technologies.Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB, DyanamoDBUse of open source tools while conducting analyses on large and unstructured datasets.Highly knowledgeable in key metric identification for driving and maintaining healthy business performance.Strong written and verbal communication skills. You will help maintain data lake, large scale distributed systems, transformation and modelling of data into usable data sets, help manage the modern data warehousing infrastructure, analyze key metrics for decision makers to provide visual insights that will change the company direction and benefit consumers. The ideal candidate will be someone who comes from a strong analytical background that has demonstrated experience in the following areas:', 'Responsibilities:', 'Create data tools and analytics for business team members that assist them in building and optimizing the product into an innovative industry leader.', "Job search is broken. The company values work life balance, rewarding risk and creativity, and an open culture. driven, and open-minded. We're perpetually in search of ways to make the job search process better, so if you if you're up for the challenge, apply and let's make it better together.", 'Build and maintain large scale distributed systems to support the whole pipeline from data collection and training to deployment and real-time key metrics and feedback.', 'Build and maintain large scale distributed systems to support the whole pipeline from data collection and training to deployment and real-time key metrics and feedback.Design and manage data architecture standards, protocols, frameworks ensuring data security and compliance with the latest industry standards.Data modeling, master data management, enterprise data warehousing, ETL, reporting, querying, requirements, analysis, and data integration techniques.Work with the engineers who use the platform and help them be more impactful by improving the platform. Build abstractions to automate various steps in different ML workflows.', 'About the Role', 'Experience in using Cloud based managed services and Big Data Environments for data warehousing/analytics is a big plus - e.g. Amazon RedShift, Snowflake.', 'Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB, DyanamoDB', 'Use of open source tools while conducting analyses on large and unstructured datasets.', 'Highly knowledgeable in key metric identification for driving and maintaining healthy business performance.', "Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field such as Mathematics and Statistics, preferably with focus on Data Analytics.", 'Required Skills', 'Analytical thinker with ability to continually analyze existing data stack and share new data product recommendations to improve data consolidation, management, analysis and interpretation.', 'Data modeling, master data management, enterprise data warehousing, ETL, reporting, querying, requirements, analysis, and data integration techniques.', 'Experience with AWS in enterprise cloud environment and technically skilled in modern big data principles and technologies.']

['', 'Research, design, implement, and evaluate novel robotics algorithms for real world problemsParticipate in software prototyping, experimental evaluation, and technology transferContribute to a portfolio of patents and academic publicationsCollaborate closely with engineering teams to drive scalable and efficient implementations', "Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.\xa0Self\xad-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.Team orientation: We work in small, fast\xad-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team.", 'Participate in software prototyping, experimental evaluation, and technology transfer', 'Qualifications:', 'Expertise in at least one of following robotics areas (robot learning, perception, decision making, planning, control, state estimation, human-robot interaction, NLP, simulation, and deep learning', 'Contribute to a portfolio of patents and academic publications', 'Research, design, implement, and evaluate novel robotics algorithms for real world problems', 'Proven track record in conferences/journals', 'The selected candidates will focus on conducting core robotics research with applications to autonomous driving, construction robotics and versatile real world problems. It requires broad knowledge of combining expertise in machine learning, computer vision, robotics, NLP, graphics and simulation to study holistic solutions for robotics and autonomous driving applications.', 'Key Responsibilities:', 'The Robotics and Auto-Driving Lab (RAL) of Baidu Research USA is looking for candidates with strong robotics or autonomous driving background. We aim to build a multi-disciplinary research team that combines expertise in robotics, machine learning, computer vision, human-robot interaction, NLP, graphics and simulation to study holistic solutions, as we strongly believe that the most significant advancement comes from the cross pollination of different areas. We aim to become a bridge that closes the gap between academic research and industrial applications. By establishing and maintaining a close relationship with world leading universities and using Baidu’s well established engineering talent, we strive to be the first to bring research lab results, from either internally or externally, to market.', 'PhD/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field', 'Culture Fit:', 'PhD/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related fieldProven track record in conferences/journalsExpertise in at least one of following robotics areas (robot learning, perception, decision making, planning, control, state estimation, human-robot interaction, NLP, simulation, and deep learningGood programming skills in C/C++ and/or pythonFamiliarity with ROS or other robotics middleware', 'Self\xad-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?', 'Good programming skills in C/C++ and/or python', 'Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.', 'Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.\xa0', 'Collaborate closely with engineering teams to drive scalable and efficient implementations', "Team orientation: We work in small, fast\xad-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team.", 'Familiarity with ROS or other robotics middleware']

(CDP) ensuring alignment with the Target Product Profile (TPP) and accounting for feasibility and regional requirements', 'Prior neurology and/or oncology experience preferred', "We're seeking a motivated Clinical Scientist to join the expanding clinical development team. The Clinical Scientist will report to the Head of Clinical Development/Medical Lead and will provide scientific, clinical, and feasibility input to early and late stage clinical development programs with an emphasis on protocol development, study monitoring, and data interpretation and presentation. This role will work on rigorous design and execution of clinical studies, as well as lead systematic literature research and technical data analyses. The Clinical Scientist will serve as a point of contact for investigators and CROs in day-to-day clinical study needs. The candidate must be highly motivated, adept at problem solving, articulate, and collaborative.", 'Author and review key documents to support clinical components of regulatory submissions (e.g., briefing documents, responses to queries, applications for expedited program designations)']

['', '  Successful Completion of a Criminal Record Check.  ', '  Leads clinical research studies from trial design to final study report for assigned projects.   Develops, prioritizes and meets measurable short- and long-term objectives for assigned clinical studies.   Provides guidance to relevant Clinical Research groups (eg, clinical operations, biostatistics, data management) involved in design and conduct of clinical studies.   Authors/reviews clinical trial protocols, investigator’s brochure, clinical study reports, clinical sections of regulatory submission documents including IND and BLA/NDS, developmental safety update reports, clinical overviews/summaries, clinical assessments.   Appropriately designs studies to meet desired clinical endpoints and with appropriate methods and measurements.   Reviews and applies current company SOPs. Revises relevant SOPs, when required.   Tracks progress of assigned clinical development programs and addresses problems as necessary   Collaborates with other internal departments including Pre-clinical, Bioanalytical, Medical Writing, Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance and corporate project management groups to ensure common goals are met.   Provides leadership/mentorship to clinical research scientists or to colleagues in other Clinical Research groups (eg, clinical operations, biostatistics, data management).   Presents internally for clinical trial/program training; externally (when required) to investigators/clinical trial site personnel (eg, site initiation visit, investigator meeting), data safety monitoring boards (DSMBs), at regulatory agency meetings, conferences and/or advisory boards.   Attends and contributes at regulatory meetings with FDA, Health Canada, EMA.   Manages relationships with clinical consultants and/or relevant clinical research organization (CRO) personnel.  ', ' A Master’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 5 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions; ', ' There are physical/mental demands and work environment characteristics that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. ', ' PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT CHARACTERISTICS ', ' Reviews and applies current company SOPs. Revises relevant SOPs, when required. ', '  An advanced degree in Life Sciences or Medicine (PhD, PharmD or MD preferred) with at least 4 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Master’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 5 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 6 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions.  ', ' Develops, prioritizes and meets measurable short- and long-term objectives for assigned clinical studies. ', ' A Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 6 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions. ', ' Experience in presentations in public or regulatory settings. Excellent organizational, analytical, leadership, problem solving and interaction skills. ', ' At least 4 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry with direct experience in designing and managing clinical studies. ', ' Provides guidance to relevant Clinical Research groups (eg, clinical operations, biostatistics, data management) involved in design and conduct of clinical studies. ', ' Manages relationships with clinical consultants and/or relevant clinical research organization (CRO) personnel. ', ' Ability to drive efforts, overcome obstacles and achieves results within budget and timeline specifications. ', ' Previous experience working in a matrix environment is highly desirable. Experience in clinical operations, biostatistics or data management is an asset. ', ' Appropriately designs studies to meet desired clinical endpoints and with appropriate methods and measurements. ', 'Knowledge, Skills & Abilities', 'Education, Experience & Skills', '  Qualified candidates will have one of the following:  An advanced degree in Life Sciences or Medicine (PhD, PharmD or MD preferred) with at least 4 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Master’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 5 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 6 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions.    ', '  There are physical/mental demands and work environment characteristics that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.   This information is available upon request from the candidate.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform all essential functions.  ', '  Ability to drive efforts, overcome obstacles and achieves results within budget and timeline specifications.   Experience in presentations in public or regulatory settings. Excellent organizational, analytical, leadership, problem solving and interaction skills.   Ability to work in a highly diverse and fast paced, team environment.   Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills, as well as excellent computer skills required.  ', ' Tracks progress of assigned clinical development programs and addresses problems as necessary ', ' Must have knowledge and understanding of Health Canada, FDA and ICH regulatory requirements and procedures applicable to Clinical Research and Product Development. ', 'Additional Requirements', ' Qualified candidates will have one of the following:  An advanced degree in Life Sciences or Medicine (PhD, PharmD or MD preferred) with at least 4 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Master’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 5 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions;   A Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences with at least 6 years of experience with a pharmaceutical company, CRO or other relevant clinical research institutions.   ', ' Attends and contributes at regulatory meetings with FDA, Health Canada, EMA. ', ' Ability to work in a highly diverse and fast paced, team environment. ', ' This information is available upon request from the candidate. ', ' Presents internally for clinical trial/program training; externally (when required) to investigators/clinical trial site personnel (eg, site initiation visit, investigator meeting), data safety monitoring boards (DSMBs), at regulatory agency meetings, conferences and/or advisory boards. ', 'Essential Functions', 'Education', ' Leads clinical research studies from trial design to final study report for assigned projects. ', 'Job Summary', ' Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills, as well as excellent computer skills required. ', '  Must have knowledge and understanding of Health Canada, FDA and ICH regulatory requirements and procedures applicable to Clinical Research and Product Development.   At least 4 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry with direct experience in designing and managing clinical studies.   Previous experience working in a matrix environment is highly desirable. Experience in clinical operations, biostatistics or data management is an asset.  ', ' Authors/reviews clinical trial protocols, investigator’s brochure, clinical study reports, clinical sections of regulatory submission documents including IND and BLA/NDS, developmental safety update reports, clinical overviews/summaries, clinical assessments. ', ' Successful Completion of a Criminal Record Check. ', ' Provides leadership/mentorship to clinical research scientists or to colleagues in other Clinical Research groups (eg, clinical operations, biostatistics, data management). ']

['', 'Minimum Qualifications', ' OR ', 'Job Announcement', 'Employment Standards', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Certificates And Licenses Required', 'Underfill Requirements', 'Physical Requirements', 'Selection Procedure', 'Fairfax County Government prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, political affiliation, or status as a veteran in the recruitment, selection, and hiring of its workforce. ', ' Plus ', 'Required Knowledge Skills And Abilities', 'PLEASE NOTE: This position may be underfilled as a Public Health Laboratory Scientist II; the underfill requirements are stated below in the Employment Standards section.', ".Certificates And Licenses RequiredPossession of a valid motor vehicle driver's license.Certification in one of the following: Medical Laboratory Scientist (MLS), Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS), Medical Technologist (MT), or in a laboratory specialty area through a nationally recognized laboratory accreditation organization.Depending on area of assignment, may be required to possess Waste Management Facility Operators License Class I and Class III.CPR required within 60 days of hire.AED required within 60 days of hire.Underfill RequirementsThis position may be underfilled as a Public Health Laboratory Scientist II (Grade S22, $54,219.36 - $90,365.81). The Minimum Qualifications for the underfill are: graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a bachelor's degree in medical/clinical laboratory science, microbiology, or chemistry;  OR  a degree in a directly related field of study;  OR completion of a post-graduate degree in a directly related field of study relevant to public health clinical laboratory testing;  Plus  four (4) years recent relevant experience performing high complexity testing in a clinical or public health laboratory environment.Within one year of hire obtain a certification in one of the following; Medical Laboratory Scientist (MLS), Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS), Medical Technologist (MT), or specialty area through a nationally recognized laboratory accreditation organization. Possession of a valid motor vehicle driver's license. Upon completion of an underfill agreement (which will require that the employee meet the employment standards stated above in addition to obtaining competencies defined by the hiring agency) the employee will be elevated to the level of Public Health Laboratory Scientist III.Necessary Special RequirementsThe appointee to this position will be required to complete a criminal background check, a check of the Child Protective Services Registry, a sanction screening, and a driving record to the satisfaction of the employer. Appointee must also complete a tuberculosis (TB) test prior to appointment.Preferred QualificationsWorking knowledge of microbiological and molecular procedures, chemistry, safety, and quality assurance. Experience and knowledge of Real Time RT-PCR and Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) is highly desirable for this position. Experience with Laboratory Information System (LIS). Ability to read, analyze, interpret and communicate complex scientific, technical, administrative and educational documents. Ability to respond effectively to sensitive inquiries or complaints from both internal and external clients. Preferred candidates will have knowledge and experience of CLIA/EPA regulatory requirements for clinical/environmental testing procedures; knowledge and experience utilizing BSL-2 and BSL-3 operations and practices; knowledge and experience of quality management systems and practices. Candidates should possess strong oral and written communication skills; must be results driven, detail oriented, and demonstrate effective and customer-oriented communication skills. Supervision of professional level staff is a plus. Experience and knowledge of Health Department policies and procedures is desirable. Preferred candidates must possess the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with diverse groups while working independently and in a collaborative team environment.Physical RequirementsWhile performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk, see, and hear. Job is generally sedentary in nature, however, job entails walking, sitting, standing, climbing stairs, reaching, and bending; uses hands to grasp, handle, or feel. Visual acuity is required to read data on computer monitor and laboratory equipment, and to distinguish fine gradation of color, bands, or structure and closely examine specimens microscopically. The incumbent must be able to operate keyboard driven equipment and possess the ability to communicate with others verbally and in writing. Employee must be able to drive a motor vehicle and may be required to lift up to 25 lbs. Must possess manual dexterity sufficient to work with small instruments and delicate laboratory equipment. All duties performed with or without reasonable accommodations.Selection ProcedurePanel interview.Fairfax County Government prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, political affiliation, or status as a veteran in the recruitment, selection, and hiring of its workforce. Reasonable accommodations are available to persons with disabilities during application and/or interview processes per the Americans with Disabilities Act. Contact 703-324-4900 for assistance. TTY 703-222-7314. EEO/AA/TTY.", 'Necessary Special Requirements']

['', 'You will be working with a team of other data scientist and data engineers to transition models which were built in SAS and deployed via excel reporting, to a scalable, fault-tolerant and highly available big data platform and scoring engine built around Revolution R Enterprise and Hadoop. The data scientist will focus specifically on retraining models built using SAS in the R environment and validating the results are as close as is reasonably possible to the legacy models. As an authoritative expert in R, you will aide in this transition by coaching and mentoring our current data science team in matters related to R and Revolution R Enterprise. This position will require you to be comfortable with a wide range of modeling techniques and validation and comparison methods. company: New York University School of Medicine
job_text: ['To apply, send your CV to Dr. Haogang Cai, at haogang.cai@nyu.edu. Please indicate the position you apply for in the subject,\xa0and include a detailed description of your research interests, a full list of publications, and names of at least two references. The position will remain open until filled.', 'We seek candidates who are strongly motivated, open-minded, and capable of both independent and collaborative research work. Demonstrated ingenuity, productivity, communication and writing skills, and an excellent record of publications is preferred.', 'Candidates must have a PhD in engineering (electrical, mechanical, etc), optics, physics, materials science or an appropriate field. Those with expertise in optical metasurfaces (near infrared, visible), nanophotonic/plasmonic sensors, nanofabrication, are encouraged to apply. Those with hands-on cleanroom experience (e.g., e-beam lithography), a strong background in optics, optical experiments, and finite-difference time domain (FDTD) simulation are preferred.', 'Postdoc in Optical Metasurface and Nanophotonics', 'The Tech4Health Institute, NYU Langone Health’s Institute for Health Technology and Engineering, is NYU Langone’s research and development hub for new biomedical instruments and technologies. The institute is located at 433 First Avenue, part of the NYU Langone superblock in Midtown Manhattan. With\xa0state-of-the-art facilities and\xa0an advanced rapid-response engineering team, the institute connects engineers and physical scientists with clinicians and life scientists to address key unsolved problems and unmet needs in biomedicine. Immersed in the unique vibrant and innovative environment of the New York City, and one of the foremost medical schools in the world, this is an ideal place for engineering researchers to design technologies to improve human health.', 'How to apply', 'haogang.cai@nyu.edu', '\xa0', 'For more information, visit the lab website at\xa0https://www.cai-labs.com/ and the institute website at https://med.nyu.edu/departments-institutes/health-technology-engineering/.', 'A postdoctoral position is immediately available in the Cai Lab, part of the Health Technology and Engineering Institute (Tech4Health) at NYU Grossman School of Medicine (recently ranked # 4 in medical schools by ‘U.S. News & World Report\u200b’). We build new paradigms of nanotechnology for biomedical applications, including optical metasurfaces for imaging and sensing, active tunable metasurfaces, and nano-engineered biomimetic materials. Our work has been published in high-impact journals including Nature Nanotechnology, Nature Materials, NPJ Comput. Mater., ACS Nano, Nano Letters, etc.', 'https://www.cai-labs.com/', 'Who we’re looking for', 'https://med.nyu.edu/departments-institutes/health-technology-engineering/.', 'Who we are']

['', 'Interested individuals should send a CV, statement of interests, and a list of three references to:', 'Postdoctoral Position in Molecular Mechanisms of Metabolic Diseases', 'Zhao.Zhang@UTSouthwestern.edu', 'Dallas, TX 75390-8505', 'UT Southwestern Medical Center is committed to an educational and working environment that provides equal opportunity to all members of the University community. In accordance with federal and state law, the University prohibits unlawful discrimination, including harassment, on the basis of: race; color; religion; national origin; sex; including sexual harassment; age; disability; genetic information; citizenship status; and protected veteran status. In addition, it is UT Southwestern policy to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.', 'Zhao Zhang, Ph.D.', 'Two postdoctoral positions are available in the laboratory of\xa0Dr. Zhao Zhang, in the Center for the Genetics of Host Defense at UT\xa0Southwestern Medical Center to study molecular mechanisms of metabolic diseases.\xa0', 'Assistant Professor', '5323 Harry Hines Blvd.\xa0', 'UT Southwestern Medical Center', 'Candidates must hold a doctoral degree (Ph.D. and/or M.D.) or are scheduled to receive a doctoral degree very soon, and should be highly motivated. Experience in cell signaling, mouse genetics, fatty liver, obesity, and diabetes research leading to publication in peer-reviewed journals is recommended.', 'Information on our postdoctoral training program and benefits can be found in our\xa0Postdoc Handbook (https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/edumedia/edufiles/graduate_school/postdoctoral_scholars/handbook.pdf) or at\xa0https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/postdocs.\xa0', 'Newly established in 2020, the Zhang laboratory employs a unique mouse forward genetic screening approach to identify new regulators of major metabolic diseases, including obesity, diabetes, and\xa0nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). We use various approaches, including biochemistry, cell biology, molecular biology, proteomics, and mouse models to study the molecular mechanisms. Our laboratory\xa0has several exciting projects related to: 1) The dynamic regulation of a newly identified E3 ubiquitin ligase in insulin signaling. 2) The role of several new genes in the regulation of obesity. 3) The mechanism of a new gene in the\xa0pathogenesis of NAFLD.\xa0The research in our laboratory is funded by start-up funding and NIH Pathway to Independence Award (K99/R00). For more details, please visit https://profiles.utsouthwestern.edu/profile/155419/zhao-zhang.html.']

company: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
job_text: ['', 'Have previous experience with writing government, and/or corporate grant proposals.', 'Have demonstrated successful team leadership experience.', 'Are skilled in concept/prototype implementations', 'You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you…', 'Have knowledge of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or data science.', ' Your primary responsibilities will be to lead research projects and conducting concept development and to perform analysis of cyber physical and autonomous systems with respect to security and safety. You will develop and present proposals, briefings, and/or reports to technical specialists, collaborators, and sponsors. You will write research papers and participate in technical conferences. ', 'Have domain knowledge in autonomous systems or industrial control systems.', 'Have proven ability to work in small teams and demonstrate critical thinking in developing solutions to complex problems.', 'You will develop and present proposals, briefings, and/or reports to technical specialists, collaborators, and sponsors.', 'Why work at APL?', "You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you...", 'Have a PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Controls Engineering, Systems Engineering, Operations Research, or related fields.', ' Have a PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Controls Engineering, Systems Engineering, Operations Research, or related fields. Have 5 years of experience conducting research in cyber-physical systems Have proven knowledge and advanced technical skills in cybersecurity, real time operating systems, systems engineering, and/or data analysis. Are skilled in concept/prototype implementations Are proficient in software engineering Are an excellent communicator, both written and oral Have proven ability to work in small teams and demonstrate critical thinking in developing solutions to complex problems. Are able to obtain Secret level security clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship. ', 'You will write research papers and participate in technical conferences.', 'Your primary responsibilities will be to lead research projects and conducting concept development and to perform analysis of cyber physical and autonomous systems with respect to security and safety.', 'Have previously worked with Allen Bradley, RSLogix, and/or other Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs).', ' Have domain knowledge in autonomous systems or industrial control systems. Have knowledge of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or data science. Have previously worked with Allen Bradley, RSLogix, and/or other Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs). Have demonstrated successful team leadership experience. Have previous experience with writing government, and/or corporate grant proposals. ', 'Have 5 years of experience conducting research in cyber-physical systems', 'Have proven knowledge and advanced technical skills in cybersecurity, real time operating systems, systems engineering, and/or data analysis.', 'Are proficient in software engineering', 'Are able to obtain Secret level security clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.', 'As a Security Researcher…', 'Are an excellent communicator, both written and oral']

job_title: Senior Director, Data Science and AI in Cybersecurity
job_text: ['', 'Presentation & communication skills: Be able to present results to a cross section of employees, including C-Level and other senior most leadership at Visa.', 'Qualifications', 'Core responsibility', 'Basic Qualifications', 'Engineering muscle: The candidate should be an engineer at heart, possessing software engineering skills besides data science skills, allowing them to lead teams that build some of the most critical and marquee products in the entire company.', "Core responsibility: Provide leadership and direction in the innovation of bleeding-edge cybersecurity analytics based technologies with a focus on data science and applied artificial intelligence techniques. This will drive Visa's competitive advantage in payments by facilitating a best in class security infrastructure. You will be heavily engaged and will collaborate with two core teams. First - Visa's insider threat team and second - PD technology/IAM/fraud teams defending against authentication related threats. In addition, you will collaborate with colleagues in technology and product offices to establish effective, productive business relationships.", 'Together', 'Track record of delivering data-driven products and insights, and influencing product and engineering decisions.', 'Work Hours ', '10+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, data engineering, or Software Engineering, with atleast 5+ of those years managing and leading Data Science or ML/software Engineering teams.', 'Job Description', "Core responsibility: Provide leadership and direction in the innovation of bleeding-edge cybersecurity analytics based technologies with a focus on data science and applied artificial intelligence techniques. This will drive Visa's competitive advantage in payments by facilitating a best in class security infrastructure. You will be heavily engaged and will collaborate with two core teams. First - Visa's insider threat team and second - PD technology/IAM/fraud teams defending against authentication related threats. In addition, you will collaborate with colleagues in technology and product offices to establish effective, productive business relationships.Fiscal discipline: You will be leading multi-million dollar global projects, working with your team and PMO organization to develop timelines, constructing business case, cost estimates, ROI, and drive deliverables on time and budgetHiring and talent management: Build and manage a team of the very top talent with a track record of recruiting talent in cybersecurity analytics, data science, and software engineering.Presentation & communication skills: Be able to present results to a cross section of employees, including C-Level and other senior most leadership at Visa.Core responsibility of team: This team is responsible for the design, implementation, and product engineering of Visa’s cyber security data analytics solutions. This team has products defending the perimeter using behavior biometrics and internally against Insider threat attacks. Using data science techniques, the team will build the tools and use cases to successfully help in the prevention of cyber attacks. Engineering muscle: The candidate should be an engineer at heart, possessing software engineering skills besides data science skills, allowing them to lead teams that build some of the most critical and marquee products in the entire company.Chief data scientist: The candidate will be using their core competencies around AI and data science and help drive their teams build models that work at scale, harnessing Petabytes of data while applying it to products that need to respond with cyber analytics in milliseconds.R&D: Lead and instrument work around developing AI prototypes and algorithms.", 'R&D:', 'Chief data scientist: The candidate will be using their core competencies around AI and data science and help drive their teams build models that work at scale, harnessing Petabytes of data while applying it to products that need to respond with cyber analytics in milliseconds.', 'Experience designing a data science roadmap and executing the vision behind it.', 'Fiscal discipline', 'You’re', 'Experience working on Behavior Biometrics and anomaly detection/fraud related usecases is a plus', 'Travel Requirements ', 'Engineering muscle:', 'Mental/Physical Requirements ', 'Essential Functions', 'Hiring and talent management: Build and manage a team of the very top talent with a track record of recruiting talent in cybersecurity analytics, data science, and software engineering.', 'Experience working on Cybersecurity Insider Threat usecases and Investigations is a plus', 'Hiring and talent management', 'Experience working on Cybersecurity Insider Threat usecases and Investigations is a plusExperience working on Behavior Biometrics and anomaly detection/fraud related usecases is a plusExperience with Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) and criminal actors and advanced knowledge of associated Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTP) is a plusDemonstrated expertise and experience with advanced and 0-day threats, intrusions, malware infection, packet analysisExperience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform)Experience working with Docker development and deployment workflows', 'Experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform)', 'We’re', 'Fiscal discipline: You will be leading multi-million dollar global projects, working with your team and PMO organization to develop timelines, constructing business case, cost estimates, ROI, and drive deliverables on time and budget', 'R&D: Lead and instrument work around developing AI prototypes and algorithms.', 'Have a Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, or related field)', 'Core responsibility of team: This team is responsible for the design, implementation, and product engineering of Visa’s cyber security data analytics solutions. This team has products defending the perimeter using behavior biometrics and internally against Insider threat attacks. Using data science techniques, the team will build the tools and use cases to successfully help in the prevention of cyber attacks. ', 'Demonstrated expertise and experience with advanced and 0-day threats, intrusions, malware infection, packet analysis', 'Presentation & communication skills:', 'Experience with Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) and criminal actors and advanced knowledge of associated Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTP) is a plus', 'Have a Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, or related field)10+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, data engineering, or Software Engineering, with atleast 5+ of those years managing and leading Data Science or ML/software Engineering teams.Experience designing a data science roadmap and executing the vision behind it.Track record of delivering data-driven products and insights, and influencing product and engineering decisions.', 'Additional Information', 'Experience working with Docker development and deployment workflows', 'Core responsibility of team', 'EEO Statement ', 'Chief data scientist:', 'Company Description', 'Preferred Qualifications']
